author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of Pondicherry University continued with their hunger strike for the second day demanding implementation of 25 per cent reservation for students of Puducherry in admissions to the institution.

Students abstained from classes on Tuesday and took out a protest march to submit a memorandum to the Acting Vice-Chancellor Anisha Basheer Khan. However, they were prevented by security personnel. Students tried to push forward even as police tried to keep them at bay. They withdrew their protest after the acting VC assured to hold talks with the representatives of students council on Wednesday.

Job promise

According to the students, when Pondicherry Central University was established in 1985, the then authorities assured of employment opportunities to the family members of the agriculturalists who donated land for establishing the university.
title: Varsity students continue strike for second day
